completedCompanyActions.title: Appoint a member of the executive team to be responsible and accountable
Remove carbon emissions that you can‘t reduce

requirements.description:
__Set your company’s measurable “big” goals for the current year. Some examples:__
- become climate neutral on Scope 1 and 2,
- become climate neutral including Scope 3,
- reduce your carbon footprint by __% this year compared to the previous year,
- improve your CO2 emissions per revenue, or CO2 emissions per employee ratio, etc.
Get a bit of inspiration for what climate-related goals the [US’ biggest companies](https://youtu.be/PvSGMiIA4CQ) and [many others](https://sciencebasedtargets.org/companies-taking-action/) have.

__It’s even better if you can make these targets [science-based](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/library/5652).__
Science based targets are goals set by companies to reduce GHG emissions in line with the latest climate science suggestions to meet the goals of the Paris Agreement (limit global warming to 1.5% above pre-industrial level). These targets can be externally verified by signing up to the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) which is a collaboration between the Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), United Nations Global Compact (UNGC), World Resources Institute (WRI), and the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF). Understanding your carbon impact across your full value chain will be a key part of setting your target. This must extend to Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions.

Every quarter, plan specific OKRs or KPIs to implement some climate-positive actions, such as initiatives that you can find in the current action plan. Set the process to measure your footprint quarterly to track dynamics and make the right decisions. 

In addition, __you can use an environmental management system (EMS)__ to systematically set targets and monitor progress. It measures the impact of your business (input, output, and everything in between), identifies areas and assets that have a significant impact, assigns a point score to each, and creates a list of targets to work toward.
requirements.title: Set specific climate-related goals and OKRs

requirements.description:
- Develop and implement formal, and job-specific, training on key sustainability issues for all executives and employees, and facilitate coaching, mentoring, and networks for sustainability knowledge sharing. 
- Educate employees about the structure of your footprint and how they can reduce it.
- Make sure that all new employees go through an induction process and training program to get them involved in your vision of sustainability strategy. It gives everyone a good grasp of what they’re here for and how they can contribute. 

Once everyone buys into the vision, you can quantify the environmental impact of various things and bring them to people’s attention. 
Teams start to see that there are budget implications, staff implications, environmental implications, and resolving this one issue could potentially improve the situation.
requirements.title: Develop internal sustainable management course/standards

requirements.description:
A “Green” team is a group of people working on reduction measures throughout your company. In most cases it’s their additional area of work, aside from their regular work. They are driven by personal values and interest in climate topics. 

How to organize the team’s work:
- conduct meetings at least once a month, 
- offer anyone to join, but ask for a commitment to actively participate,
- invite senior-level colleagues, representing departments which influence your carbon footprint the most to this team, 
- if more than 10-12 people want to participate, build smaller sub-teams,
- set objective goals and work on actions that have the biggest impact on your carbon footprint, 
- let all employees know your green team's plans and successes transparently and regularly.
requirements.title: Set up a “Green” team

requirements.description: Mark this action as done if you conduct regular sustainability workshops with external experts/consultants at least once a year. It’s important to stay updated with new industry solutions and use external inputs to drive inner projects.
requirements.title: Sustainability workshops for your team

requirements.description:
If you are ready to reconsider your business model, appoint a transition team.
This team will set a new strategy for the business, which includes setting science based targets and steps for implementing changes to the business model. External input might be required if your in-house capability is limited. 

1. Start by identifying areas of conflict, or potential conflict, between your core business model and factors of potentially negative environmental impact (e.g. production of or reliance on fossil fuels or other finite resources). 
2. For each conflict, review ways in which the negative impact identified could be altered to become positive. In many cases this will require some radically creative thinking and a workshop environment.
3. Facilitation by an outside expert could be useful. For example: If your company manufactures washing machine components, and you identify that your (finite) raw input material is likely to become scarcer (therefore more expensive) over the next 10 - 20 years, you could consider a move to a leasing model whereby you retain ownership of the component, lease it to your customer, and recover it for remanufacturing or reuse after it has reached end of life. 
4. It is vital to identify where your business has the biggest carbon impact. These departments should then be considered a priority. Remember, your biggest impact could be outside of your head office.
requirements.title: Business model transformation

completedCompanyActions.title: Develop sustainable management principles

completedCompanyActions.description: There are many established as well as new banks that offer similar services to their traditional competitors, except for one important difference: They invest your money according to high sustainability standards.

requirements.description:
Your corporate finance can influence the climate more than you think. Use this power:
- Look at how the company capital is secured, such as where it gets its project financing and loans. Where possible, move this business to [banks](https://www.triodos.co.uk/about-us) that refuse to invest in businesses dependent on fossil fuels.
- Talk to your accountants. They can help set up systems to measure and manage climate related externalities. They can support your finance team in raising and allocating the funds your organization needs for transition and adaptation, embedding greenhouse gas (GHG) reductions within your organization’s decision-making processes, and accurately tracking and reporting performance against reduction targets. 
- If your company operates in the financial sector, ensure your financial investments support [low carbon initiatives](http://fossilfreefunds.org).
requirements.title: Use a "green" bank for your corporate banking

completedCompanyActions.title: Move to a bank that puts sustainability first

completedCompanyActions.description:
Note: you need to work with a third party to calculate Scope 3 emissions and get this badge.

Even if you’re not ready yet to commit to offsetting your extended footprint, it’s worth measuring it regularly and tracking changes.

requirements.description:
To calculate Scope 3 emissions, you need to use more sophisticated calculation tools than for Scope 1 and 2, as you should collect data about nearly all your business processes and products.

Consider these options from non-profit organizations: [Smart 3 by MyClimate](https://www.myclimate.org/information/news-press/news/newsdetail/a-management-tool-for-new-and-existing-partners-myclimate-smart-3/), [Climate Neutral](https://bee.climateneutral.org/)

You can also find calculation tools specialized in some product groups: food, travel, fashion, etc.
requirements.title: Calculate Scope 3 emissions

requirements.description:
It’s not a one-time action.You can start with 100% offsetting for the previous year, but in general it means that you include the costs of product offsetting in your prices and/or cut your margins. 
You can also negotiate with your suppliers and share offsetting costs with them. 

If you are not ready for such measures yet, you can offer your customers to buy products themselves or with additional offsetting prices. It’s the easiest and safest option, but it will not help you to cover even half of Scope 3 emissions.
requirements.title: Offset 100% of the calculated footprint

completedCompanyActions.title: Complete Climate Neutrality
Map out your full supply chain footprint (Scope 3)

requirements.title: Have at least one climate related talk / event / lunch every 6 months

completedCompanyActions.title: Host regular climate action talks
Implement the "We take climate action" badge on your website

requirements.description:
One of the projects where you can find cleaning products and soap without microplastic: [Zero Waste Era](https://www.zerowasteera.com)

Mark this action as completed if you will buy only eco-friendly cleaning products and soap for your office from now on.
requirements.title: Conscious office cleaning: eco-friendly cleaning products, minimal bins and plastic bags

requirements.description:
Mark this action as completed if you will buy office supplies made from recycled materials, produced and delivered in an eco-friendly way from now on. 

Recycled paper is 100% made from used paper, saving resources and water. Although the recycled paper is no longer pure white, it is also free of peroxides, sodium carbonate, and sodium hydroxide. These chemicals are used both in the production of fresh fibre paper and for bleaching paper. Recycled paper has two to three times lower energy consumption during production. 

At [Memo](http://www.memo.de), [EarthHero](https://earthhero.com/product-category/home/office-supplies/), or [GreenPicks](https://www.greenpicks.de/en/office-supplies-stationery/) you can find all of your sustainable office supplies.
requirements.title: Eco-friendly office supplies: paper, post-its, pens, business cards, etc.

requirements.description:
Our aim here is to minimize the delivery footprint and support local businesses.
Only purchase food and drinks with verified environmental standards.
requirements.title: Responsible food and drink: local, organic, seasonal

requirements.description:
Here are some ideas on how to make your marketing materials more eco-friendly:
- at conferences, fairs, and festivals, consider digital ways to interact with potential customers: screens, VR & AR, QR-codes, projections, e-business cards, and catalogs, etc.
- if you do choose to produce some giveaways, opt for materials with less of an end-of-life process
- order production locally to avoid causing additional emissions through deliveries
- improve your planning process to minimize waste after events.
requirements.title: Minimal giveaways: t-shirts, flyers, stickers, etc.

requirements.description:
What you can do:
- encourage your colleagues to order food delivery less: organize lunch in your office, subsidize lunch in the nearest cafes, or arrange food delivery in reusable containers,
- make sure you use glasses in your office and wash them instead of one-use plastic cups,
- buy beverages in returnable glass bottles,
- buy office snacks in bigger packages with less plastic.
requirements.title: Minimal plastic waste: no plastic cups and bottles, reduced food delivery waste

requirements.description:
What you can do to print less:
- implement electronic signature systems where possible
- instead of printing reports before business meetings, use more screens in meeting rooms
- decrease the amount of pages by reducing font or page border sizes of regularly printed documents: contracts, agreements, etc.
- add a reminder to print less in your corporate signatures
- as a default setting, double-sided printing in black and white is recommended.

Plus, you can recycle your printer cartridges using a free recycling box from [Caritas](https://www.caritas.de/spendeundengagement/andershelfen/caritasbox/caritasboxstartseite).
requirements.title: Minimal printing policy

requirements.description:
These purchases can influence your carbon footprint significantly. 
- implement a repair-first policy: it's better to fix a laptop than buy a new one
- regularly calculate and check the footprint created by your equipment purchases (some companies, such as [Apple](https://www.apple.com/environment/pdf/products/notebooks/13-inch_MacBookPro_PER_may2019.pdf) and [Dell](https://i.dell.com/sites/csdocuments/CorpComm_Docs/en/carbon-footprint-latitude-7490.pdf), share data about their products’ footprint on their websites)
- when you need to buy things for your new office, don't just pay attention to them being made of ‘natural’ materials, but also to their production footprint
- utilize old and broken equipment in specially designated places.
requirements.title: Responsible use of office equipment and furniture

requirements.description:
Make sure that:
- you have a company-wide recovery and recycling program that includes: paper, cardboard, plastic, glass, metal, and composting
- you recycle waste not only from the kitchen but also all papers in your working spaces, cartons at your warehouse, etc.
- your utility service works with all types of waste after you separate it, so it goes into the correct waste sorting centers.
requirements.title: Proper waste separation system

requirements.description:
Install low-flow faucets, toilets, and urinals in your office. 
Low-flow should meet or exceed the following EPA WaterSense standards: faucets use a maximum of [1.5 gpm](http://www.epa.gov/WaterSense/products/bathroom_sink_faucets.html), toilets - [max 1.28 gallons per flush](http://www.epa.gov/WaterSense/products/toilets.html).
requirements.title: Water conservation

completedCompanyActions.title: Apply sustainability principles in your office
Introduce a “green” information channel

requirements.title: Mark this action as planned to enroll in the program
Use your product or service to do good

completedCompanyActions.title: Join the "Time for Climate Action" Campaign

completedCompanyActions.description: Meat and dairy consumption cause a lot of carbon emissions. By minimizing carbon-intensive food and drinks you can decrease your footprint significantly.

requirements.description:
Make sure that:
- you don't serve any meat
- you offer a plant-based milk option or serve only plant-based milk
- you minimize food waste
We can't control what people eat at home but, as a company, we can decide what to buy based on our values.

Some vegan and local catering providers for your reference: 
 [Pele Mele](http://www.pele-mele-berlin.de/catering/), [Fake Gourmet](https://www.facebook.com/fakegourmetberlin/), [Yummy Mummy](https://www.facebook.com/yummymummyberlin/?hc_location=ufi), [Goodies Deli](https://goodies-deli.com/pages/catering), [Hummus Dealer](https://www.facebook.com/hummusdealer/), [Beets and Roots](https://www.beetsandroots.de/catering), [My Goodness](https://www.mygoodnessberlin.com/), [No Tiers Vegan Catering](https://www.facebook.com/NoTiersVeganCatering/), [TRJFP](https://www.facebook.com/TRJFPBerlin/), [Gayaya](https://www.gayaya-berlin.de/en/home-en.html#catering-en), [Smunch](https://www.smunch.co/).
These projects are based in Berlin, but for those of you who are based elsewhere, they give you a general idea of what’s available and you can find similar options in your area.
 
Mark this action as completed if you do not  cater meat in your office and during business events.
requirements.title: Vegan catering and snacks

completedCompanyActions.title: Veggie Food & Catering

completedCompanyActions.description: You cannot improve if you don't know where you are standing. Use either our build-in carbon estimator or work with a third party to analyze your carbon footprint. Afterwards offset your footprint and upload the certificate as a confirmation.

requirements.title: Decide how you want to measure your emissions

requirements.description: It all starts with measuring.
requirements.title: Measure your footprint

completedCompanyActions.title: Measure and understand your full scope carbon footprint

completedCompanyActions.description: Switching to a 100% renewable energy provider for your office energy is a simple but effective step to reduce your company's carbon footprint. It is important to use a reliable provider which transparently communicates the orgins of its energy.

requirements.description:
Switch to a 100% renewable energy provider, including electricity and other energy consumption from heating, hot water, etc. Often it’s the most impactful thing companies can do immediately. 

Even if you lease your office, it's still possible to switch, but it requires some time and effort.

We recommend the following green electricity providers in Germany: [Greenpeace Energy](http://www.epa.gov/WaterSense/products/toilets.html), [Naturstrom](https://www.naturstrom.de/geschaeftskunden/), [Elektrizitäts Werke Schönau](https://www.ews-schoenau.de/ews/energiedienstleistungen/angebote-fuer-gewerbekunden/) 

Note: The difference in savings from the future footprint offsetting will often be more than a slight increase in energy cost.
requirements.title: Your office (and warehouses) run on 100% renewable energy

completedCompanyActions.title: Power your offices with Renewable Energy

completedCompanyActions.description: By supporting the Climate Demo's of the Fridays for Future movement, you can help to increase the pressure on politicians. Many big companies like Atlassian, Flixbus, Kickstarter and many more do it already. Join them!

requirements.description: Give your employees a few free hours or half a day off to go to important climate strikes.
requirements.title: Share the news on social media

requirements.description: Use your Marketing channels and social media reach to support big climate demonstrations.
requirements.title: Participate in the strike as a team event

completedCompanyActions.title: Actively support climate strikes

requirements.title: Implement and promote incentives for an eco-conscious lifestyle

completedCompanyActions.title: Incentivize climate positive lifestyle choices

completedCompanyActions.title: Motivate your customers to take climate action

requirements.title: Organize and execute regular park clean ups

completedCompanyActions.title: Outdoor events: city cleanups and tree planting days
Run your own digital infrastructure on 100% Renewable Energy

completedCompanyActions.description: Cutting down on your flights and moving towards train travel has a significant impact on your carbon footprint.

requirements.description:
For domestic routes under five hours by train, take the train.
Railway stations are often more centrally located than airports, which makes arrival and departure easier and reduces the footprint of using taxis.  

Mark this action as completed as soon as you change your corporate travel policy accordingly.
requirements.title: Trains over planes policy

requirements.description:
For intercontinental travel, a seat in business class produces __two to three times__ as much CO2 as an economy seat. 
First-class seats even produce up to __six times__ as much CO2.

Mark this action as completed as soon as you change your corporate travel policy and make sure that you buy only economy class tickets from now on.
requirements.title: Economy class flights only

completedCompanyActions.title: Setup a policy for responsible business travel
Donate to climate engaged non-profits
